description: Papua New Guinea, April 9, the Prime Minister has urged the public not to stigmatize people who are infected with Covid-19 or suspected of having the virus. Mr Marape said someone who tested positive to Covid-19 was not a threat to society, so people should remain calm and patient.

"Minister for Information & Communication Technology, Hon. Timothy Masiu today urged Papua New Guineans not to believe unsubstantiated claims that the roll out of 5G technology is somehow responsible for the spread of COVID-19 in PNG and around the world."

Papua New Guinea, State of Emergency Controller David Manning has issued a curfew for the National Capital District, Central and Western Provinces. People are required to stay in their homes from 8 pm until 6 am daily unless they are to seek urgent medical attention or moving in an emergency. Effective April 16 until April 30, unless extended by the Emergency Controller.

description:
In Papua New Guinea "Definition and designation of First Port of Entry; entry of vehicle, vessel or aircraft coming into PNG only through First Port of Entry; entry of persons to PNG (including citizens and permanent residents) by aircraft and vessels; No person is permitted to board an aircraft bound for PNG unless tested for COVID-19 using RT-PCR within 14-day period prior to boarding and have returned negative results; exemption can be given in writing by Controller; these measuers do not apply to persons approved to enter PNG on or prior to 20 June; suspension of traditional border crossing arrangements (with indonesia, Australia, FSM, Solomon Islands); boarding of aircraft bound for PNG only with exemption in writing by Controller; quarantine of returning
citizens and permanent residents at designated facilities (at Government's cost) or designated hotels (at individuals' cost); quarantine of non-citizens and non-permanent residents at designated hotels (at individuals' cost); self-quarantine of foreign diplomats at appropriate residence for 14 days;failure to adhere to self-quarantine as an offence under National Pandemic Act 2020 and declaration as persona non grata of those who fail to comply; quarantine exemption
granted by Controller;requirements for compliance for self-isolation and quarantine;conditions for leaving a designated place prior to completion of 14 days; and authorized officials to ensure appropriate levels of surveillance and border monitoring systems" UPDATE: The original restriction required written approval from pandemic response controller, the restriction has been lifted as of the 16th of August.
type_sub_cat: Health Certificates
target_geog_level: All countries
compliance: Mandatory with Exceptions (Please list exceptions in the text entry),Mandatory (Other; please list other enforcement mechanisms in the text entry)

description:
In Papua New Guinea "On 17 May, SOE Controller issued National Emergency Order No 37 regarding COVID-19 Surveillance and
Testing: National case definition for COVID-19 and Severe Acute Respiratory Infection (SARI); confirmation by PCR test only; all PHAs, Port Moresby General Hospital and private hospitals to submit daily
reports to Emergency Controller by 6pm; if any cluster of respiratory illness or influenza like illness cases reported, swab between 5-10 cases for the cluster for testing within 24 hours; and each PHA shall swab minimum of 5 patients with influenza like illness symptoms per week.
enforcer: Ministry/Department of Health,New (COVID-19 specific) Task Force

description: Papua New Guinea's State-of-Emergency Controller announced on May 20, 2020 that the Port Moresby General Hospital, provincial health authorities and private hospitals are required to submit daily reports by 6pm that must include case investigation forms for all suspected Covid-19 cases, details of deaths relating to respiratory illnesses, the number of persons swabbed for Covid-19 testing and any other information they are directed to provide.

description: In Papua New Guinea "Mandatory mask wearing in Port Moresby effective on 29 July 2020. The measures specified wearing masks or face coverings in enclosed space in establishments, aircraft, public transport and designated markets."
type_text: There has been a measure put in place to enforce the mandatory wearing of masks in public and enclosed spaces.

description: Papua New Guinea "disseminated messages on effective hand washing and personal hygiene in schools in Port Moresby"
enforcer: Other (Please specify in the text box)

description: Papua New Guinea Prime Minister Marapes's address to the Nation on Coronavirus

Papua New Guinea Police Commissioner David Manning today "set in place plans to prepare a Pandemic Plan for the Constabulary should the world outbreak of coronavirus reach Papua New Guinea shores" March 17

Papua New Guinea Police Commissioner announced that "anyone intentionally spreading information not from an official source such as the Department of Health will be arrested and charged under our Cyber Crime laws." March 17
Papua New Guinea Department of Health in partnership with Digicel PNG has launched a Toll Free number facility to fight the COVID-19 endemic in the country
enforcer: National Government,Other (Please specify in the text box)

description: Papua New Guinea's Prime Minister announces on March 20 that "only the PM and Health Minister Jelta Wong will be the only two making formal statements on COVID-19 going into the future"

Papua New Guinea National Parliamentary Service (NPS) staff attended an awareness presentation on the Novel Coronavirus (COVID-19) by Dr. Duncan Sengiromo, Emergency Medicine Specialist with the Port Moresby General Hospital (POMGH) on the first day of the national 14-day lockdown period, March 24.
enforcer: National Government,Other (Please specify in the text box)

description: Papua New Guinea, "Colgate-Palmolive Health Educator Minhee Kook, apart from her presentation on the importance of clean hands promoting good health, did a demonstration on the correct way to wash hands and how to use a “Tippy-Tap”; a hands-free device for hand washing that is especially designed for rural areas where there is no running water."
enforcer: National Government,Other (Please specify in the text box)

description: "the Prime Minister is urging all Papua New Guinean and residents to do their part to stop the virus spreading in the country.He is asking everyone to follow directions from the Government to assist the work that is being done by the COVID-19 National Security Emergency Response Task Force."
type_sub_cat: Gathering information related to COVID-19 from the public
enforcer: National Government,Ministry/Department of Health,New (COVID-19 specific) Task Force

description: Papua New Guinea's police chief has warned "anyone spreading false information during the Covid-19 State of Emergency will be charged" April 6

In Papua New Guinea "On 4 to 15 May, the NCD PHA with the support from NDoH, WHO, UNICEF and World Vision organized a 10-day city-wide sensitization and training programme to support public awareness
raising of potential risks and the impact on communities through a network of COVID-19 community leader advocates."
type_sub_cat: Disseminating information related to COVID-19 to the public that is reliable and factually accurate
enforcer: Ministry/Department of Health,New (COVID-19 specific) Task Force

description: The Health Secretary of Bougainville announced today that Bougainvilleans will begin receiving short coronavirus awareness messages on their mobile phones and will be able to call the Bougainville COVID-19 Hotline number for free, starting May 17 for all Digicel subscribers.
type_sub_cat: Disseminating information related to COVID-19 to the public that is reliable and factually accurate

description: In Papua New Guinea "On 18 May, NDoH established an “Epidemiological Intelligence Working Group” for NOC surveillance operation, co-chaired by NDoH and WHO; and consisting of members from NDoH, WHO, CPHL, ADB,Pacific HR and IMR.. The main objective of this working group is to establish a coordinated and collaborative approach to collection, analysis and interpretation of COVID-19 surveillance data to inform COVID-19 response and decision making."
type_sub_cat: Gathering information related to COVID-19 from the public
enforcer: Ministry/Department of Health,Other (Please specify in the text box)

description: Papua New Guinea's autonomous region of Bougainville has opened a facility with an information booth and a hand-washing station on Friday, May 22. The facility is placed in the town of Buka on Bougainville.
type_sub_cat: Disseminating information related to COVID-19 to the public that is reliable and factually accurate

description: The provincial government of Madang, Papua New Guinea, has partnered with its councilors to spread information and awareness on the Covid-19 virus by distributing around 500 fliers and brochures in the Madang and Rai Coast districts, announced on June 2nd, 2020.
type_sub_cat: Disseminating information related to COVID-19 to the public that is reliable and factually accurate

description: Papua New Guinea announces a "14-day quarantine and medical clearances for all incoming travelers from countries affected by coronavirus"
type_sub_cat: Self-Quarantine (i.e. quarantine at home)
target_geog_level: All countries

description: Papua New Guinea extends lockdown for another two months UPDATE: Original lockdown was set to last until April 6, but has been extended to June 6
type_sub_cat: Self-Quarantine (i.e. quarantine at home)
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: Papua New Guinea Prime Minister announces that "any Papua New Guineans permitted to enter by aircraft will be quarantined at a designated facility in Port Moresby at the Government's cost."
type_sub_cat: Government Quarantine (i.e. quarantine at a government hotel or facility)
target_geog_level: All countries

description: Papua New Guinea Prime Minister states that "any non-PNG citizen or non-permanent resident returning to PNG by aircraft to be quarantined at a designated hotel in Port Moresby at the individual's cost."
type_sub_cat: Quarantine outside the home or government facility (i.e. quarantine in a hotel)
target_geog_level: All countries

description: Papua New Guinea Prime Minister stated on April 9th, 2020, that "any non-PNG citizen or non-permanent resident returning to PNG by aircraft to be quarantined at a designated hotel in Port Moresby at the individual's cost." On May 21st, the SoE Controller announced that any non-citizen breaking the quarantine rules will be deported immediately. UPDATE: Whereas the original quarantine policy did not specify the penalties faced by non-citizens breaking quarantine rules, the State of Emergency Controller has announced, on May 21st, 2020, that any non-citizen breaking the quarantine rules will immediately be deported, with any cost related to deportation borne by that person.
type_sub_cat: Quarantine outside the home or government facility (i.e. quarantine in a hotel)
target_geog_level: All countries
compliance: Mandatory with Exceptions (Please list exceptions in the text entry),Mandatory (Other; please list other enforcement mechanisms in the text entry)

description: As a result of 66 people evading quarantine in Papua New Guinea, "Manning said officers of the Correctional Services will join the Covid-19 operations to monitor quarantined persons and ensure they remain in designated quarantine facilities for the entire 14 days. He issued an Emergency Order to seize the passports of Papua New Guineans who breached quarantine protocols.The passports will be held for the duration of the state of emergency.“Upon conviction for non-compliance, an application will be made to the Minister for Immigration for the cancellation of their passports,”
type_sub_cat: Government Quarantine (i.e. quarantine at a government hotel or facility)
compliance: Mandatory (Other; please list other enforcement mechanisms in the text entry)

description: Papua New Guinea Prime Minister states that "any non-PNG citizen or non-permanent resident returning to PNG by aircraft to be quarantined at a designated hotel in Port Moresby at the individual's cost." UPDATE: The original policy only indicated that non-PNG citizens or non PNG permanent residents had to be quarantined at a designated hotel, it now has additional conditions that requires the foreign travelers to be fit with electronic ankle monitors for the duration of the quarantine.
type_sub_cat: Quarantine outside the home or government facility (i.e. quarantine in a hotel)
target_geog_level: All countries

description: Papua New Guinea, Emergency Controller David Manning, has announced the closure of restaurants with the exception of take away food and non-alcoholic drinks. Effective April 16 until April 30.
type_sub_cat: Restaurants
target_geog_level: One or more geographical or administrative units within one or more countries
target_province: National Capital District; Central Province; Western Province

description:
Papua New Guinea "Measures apply to the NCD and Central Province;no operation of public transport; taxis can operate so long as the driver wear mask or face covering and do not operate during curfew hours; private
transportation may continue to operate but not limited to hotel and security transportation; these measures came into effect since 29 July 2020"
type_sub_cat: Transportation (land; water and air)
institution_status: This type of business  ("Transportation (land; water and air)") is allowed to open with conditions

description: Papua New Guinea bans "cruise ships and yachts used for leasure with more than 15 people on board"
compliance: Mandatory with Legal Penalties (Jail Time),Mandatory with Fines

description: Papua New Guinea Prime Minister announces banning gatherings of more than 100 people starting March 20.

In Papua New Guinea "No affliated sporting codes shall train or participate in matches unless with approval from PNG Sports Foundation; responsibilities of PNG Sports Foundation are requirement to submit weekly report to controller; requirements for local religious activities in social distancing and hygiene standards; banning of religous gatherings such as provincial and national church gatherings,
crusades, conventions and provincial or national outreach programmes; licensed gambling venues, nighclub, hourse racing at listed venues to operate on Wednesdays, Thursdays, Fridays and Saturdays; and ban on gatherings of over 100 persons."
type_sub_cat: Cancellation of an annually recurring event
